title: can't install package
body:
###### Info

- **Version**: 
-      node: 14.21.3
-      npm: 6.14.18
                      
- **OS**: Windows 11


###### Steps to reproduce

1.I pulled project:
      ```git clone ...```
2.Then I try to install the package according to the readme.md:
    ```npm ci```
    then encountered a problem:
   
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33616855/224207266-d13b2bf3-1403-448d-8bc6-19cf3f212959.png)

3.I searched for ways to solve the error,it is said that it should be implemented first ```npm install``` so I did and then I have encountered a new problem:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33616855/224208271-7eec23f5-ed44-4522-bdbe-44f2173ec899.png)
It is said that I cannot open a project with vs code so I opened the project by git-bash and try again,and then I have encountered a new problem:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33616855/224211076-13468e20-01c5-452e-aca3-c24ba82c2370.png)
This error seems to be the lack of some building tools,but my computer has python and visual studio,So I don't know where the problem is and what to do

###### What do you expect to happen?

install the package and run the project

Thanks!
Any comment on how you fixed it?

> Any comment on how you fixed it?



> Any comment on how you fixed it?

Oh, this solution process is too complex. I need to take some time to organize my repair process

> > Any comment on how you fixed it?
> 
> > Any comment on how you fixed it?
> 
> Oh, this solution process is too complex. I need to take some time to organize my repair process

Any way I could contact you? Need to be able to run the wallet ASAP ğŸ˜£

I recorded my process of solving this problem to help those in need

1.
Firstly, you need to use node v12 or v14. I forgot which version I used successfully. It's been some time since this issue passed, so you can try everything. After you modify your node version, you need to change the corresponding NPM version. There are no specific requirements for the NPM version, which can be adapted to your node version.

2.
After changing the node version, the first possible issue you may encounter is as shown in the above figure. You cannot execute the ```npm ci``` command, which will prompt that your package lock.json file and the library used in package. json need to be the same version. Therefore, you need to first execute the ```npm update --save-dev``` command to update your package. json. It should be noted here that because devDependencies are useful in package.json, many of the library versions are very old (such as babel), which can cause various strange problems. Therefore, you need to execute ```npm update -- save-dev``` instead of ```npm update``` to update the libraries in devDependencies

3. 
When you execute the ```npm update --save-dev```command, you may encounter the problem shown in the second image above, which is that you cannot execute the npm command in VS code. At this point, you need to use git bash to open your project instead of using vs code

Supplement: 
Regarding 2, the option 'resolutions' is available in package.json, which locks the versions of the libraries in it. These libraries are also very old and the ```npm update --save-dev``` command will not update them. When I was about to run this project, the version of the library in resolutions caused me to fail, so you need to delete this option. 

By the way, because my country has a firewall and is not very friendly in accessing Github's servers, when installing Github's repository instead of NPM's repository, the problem shown in the following figure always appears,such as:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33616855/233955609-32646a2e-2146-4938-ada4-285659a3daa3.png)
the following issues will always appear:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33616855/233955781-b6463d6f-2243-4ed8-9af0-9a355a67bbd2.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33616855/233956043-bc37a3b4-f073-4c9b-b922-20876df09a22.png)
I won't give any examples of other libraries installed from Github, but the solution is the same: download from NPM instead of Github:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33616855/233958405-e233a4fd-178e-412b-952e-4765e0bacd14.png)
If your country has good access to Github's services, ignore this issue.

Another issue with package.json is that you may encounter problems with Babel when working due to many library updates that have transitioned from CommonJS to ESM. Solving ESM issues requires Babel v7 or higher, and this library is no longer called Babel core but renamed @ Babel/core with many associated libraries such as @ Babel/cli. You need to change all of them to this
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33616855/233957332-1eb01b38-e0bd-4f0f-b493-1f264753e78b.png)

In short, you need to modify many aspects of package.json. I will showcase my successful package.json here for your reference:

{
  "name": "myetherwallet",
  "version": "6.6.16-hotfix.1",
  "description": "Client side ethereum wallet",
  "scripts": {
    "build": "npm run update && vue-cli-service build",

    "lint": "npm run lint:code && npm run lint:md",
    "apollo": "apollo",
    "apollo:aave": "apollo service:download -c=apolloAave.config.js src/dapps/aave-dapp/apollo/schemas/api.json && apollo client:codegen -c=apolloAave.config.js src/dapps/aave-dapp/apollo/global/globalTypes.json --target=json",
    "apollo:codegen": "npm run apollo:schema && apollo client:codegen src/apollo/global/globalTypes.json --target=json",
    "apollo:schema": "apollo service:download src/apollo/schemas/api.json",
    "build:hash": "ROUTER_MODE=hash npm run build",
    "build:history": "ROUTER_MODE=history npm run build",
    "build:history:sourcemaps": "ROUTER_MODE=history FULL_SOURCEMAPS=true npm run build",
    "build:offline": "WEBPACK_INTEGRITY=false BUILD=offline npm run build:hash",

    "start:history": "npm run update:mainlists && ROUTER_MODE=history npm run dev",

4
Okay, now let's continue. When you execute the ```npm update --save-dev``` command, you may encounter the problem with the third image I showed at the top. Here's an explanation. The general meaning of this issue is that your Windows system lacks C++building tools or Visual Studio, or other necessary tools for this project. That is to say, if you are not using a Windows system, you may not have this problem. If you are using a Windows system and have successfully encountered this issue, then continue to read on.

Firstly, you need to execute ```npm install --global --production windows-build-tools```. Executing this command generally does not lead to a smooth installation, and you may encounter various strange problems. However, Google or ChatGPT can search for solutions to these problems, so I won't mention them here. Here I want to say that you need to install the version of Visual Studio 2017:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33616855/233963814-d12578fd-c0a6-40f1-af98-0d09c4d0eb58.png)
Other versions may have issues, such as the Visual Studio 15 version I tried, which will report this error:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33616855/233963967-730c2cc3-2a52-4efd-b949-2f1b52d2c991.png)

5
After solving the problem in 4, clear the cache ```npm cache clean - f``` and delete the node_ modules, execute ```npm update --save-dev``` again, you may encounter these issues:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33616855/233965025-9a961f89-fd2e-44e1-aa90-f1aad78270c1.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33616855/233965106-08a7aa46-4022-4b82-99e0-233745b85f40.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33616855/233965280-3d4c0f92-848f-408c-98d1-fdb4e8c4a73b.png)
These issues are caused by the inability to access Github's server. As above, if your network does not have this issue, ignore it. If it does, you cannot solve it by modifying package.json at this time because your package.json is already correct, and you can only continuously try ```npm update --save-dev```.Believe me, as long as I keep trying, I will definitely succeed, because when I try as many times as my hair, I succeed, and in the end, this command successfully generates a new package-lock. json. 
At this point, you should note that the ```npm update --save-dev``` command does not fully install all dependencies. At this point, all dependencies in your package. json should have been updated to the latest version, which is the package. json I showed above. At this point, you need to delete node_modules, clear the cache ```npm cache clean - f```,and then execute ```npm install```. Note that it is not ```npm ci```. During the process of executing ```npm install```, you may encounter the same problem as ```npm update --save-dev```, where the github service cannot be accessed. The same solution is to repeat these steps:
delete node_ modules
clear cache ```npm cache clean -f```
Install dependency ```npm install```
Until you have no installation dependencies that report errors.

6
Now that we have successfully installed the dependency, I did not execute the ```npm run build``` because I do not need to package at the moment. I executed the ```npm start``` command and reported an error. I did not find a screenshot of the error here to roughly explain, because the ```npm start``` command executed this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33616855/233975562-e6e61495-3af3-430d-8527-df3eef8c3264.png)
The problem lies in this index.js file, as it contains a lot of code to pull requests from github:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33616855/233975795-b46b923f-31c6-496e-8702-7f22b2189815.png)
That's how I solved it. I annotate the code related to the request, then access the request address from the browser to obtain the corresponding JSON files, save these files in the project, and modify the corresponding import code where these files are used.Okay, that's it.
@ItsLuized After resolving these issues, I successfully ran this project. I hope my records will be helpful to you.

> @ItsLuized After resolving these issues, I successfully ran this project. I hope my records will be helpful to you.
